items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Storage and Media Processing

*   [DocsParse](https://docsparse.com/) ‚Äì GPT powered AI processing of PDFs, Images, into structured data in JSON, CSV, EXCEL formats. 30 credits for free each month.
items.content_html:
Storage and Media Processing

  • DocsParse ‚Äì GPT powered AI processing of PDFs, Images, into structured data in JSON, CSV, EXCEL formats. 30 credits for free each month.

items.title: Awesome K6
items.content_text:
### Extensions / Official

*   [xk6-client-tracing (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-client-tracing) - Client for load testing distributed tracing backends.
*   [xk6-disruptor (‚≠ê110)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-disruptor) - Inject faults to test üí£.
*   [xk6-exec (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-exec) - Run external commands.
*   [xk6-kubernetes (‚≠ê70)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-kubernetes) - Interact with Kubernetes clusters.
*   [xk6-loki (‚≠ê51)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-loki) - Client for load testing Loki.
*   [xk6-notification (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-notification) - Create notifications.
*   [xk6-output-influxdb (‚≠ê76)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-output-influxdb) - Export results to InfluxDB v2.
*   [xk6-output-kafka (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-output-kafka) - Export k6 results in real-time to Kafka.
*   [xk6-output-timescaledb (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-output-timescaledb) - Export k6 results to TimescaleDB.
*   [xk6-sql (‚≠ê156)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-sql) - Load-test SQL Servers (PostgreSQL, MySQL and SQLite3 for now).
*   [xk6-ssh (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-ssh) - SSH.

### Extensions / Community

*   [xk6-cable (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/anycable/xk6-cable) - Test Action Cable and AnyCable functionality.
*   [xk6-coap (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/golioth/xk6-coap) - Interact with Constrained Application Protocol endpoints.
*   [xk6-dotenv (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/szkiba/xk6-dotenv) - Load env vars from a .env file.
*   [xk6-ethereum (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/distribworks/xk6-ethereum) - K6 extension for ethereum protocols.
*   [xk6-faker (‚≠ê100)](https://github.com/szkiba/xk6-faker) - Generate random fake data.
*   [xk6-file (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/avitalique/xk6-file) - Write files.
*   [xk6-g0 (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/szkiba/xk6-g0) - Write k6 tests in golang.
*   [xk6-kafka (‚≠ê182)](https://github.com/mostafa/xk6-kafka) - Load-test Apache Kafka. Includes support for Avro messages.
*   [xk6-kv (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/oleiade/xk6-kv) - Share key-value data between VUs.
*   [xk6-mock (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/szkiba/xk6-mock) - Mock HTTP(S) servers.
*   [xk6-mqtt (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/pmalhaire/xk6-mqtt) - MQTT extension.
*   [xk6-nats (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/ydarias/xk6-nats) - Provides NATS support for k6 tests.
*   [xk6-opentelemetry (‚≠ê32)](https://github.com/thmshmm/xk6-opentelemetry) - Generate OpenTelemetry signals from within your test scripts.
*   [xk6-output-elasticsearch (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/elastic/xk6-output-elasticsearch) - Export results to Elasticsearch 8.x.
*   [xk6-output-prometheus-pushgateway (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/martymarron/xk6-output-prometheus-pushgateway) - Export results to Prometheus pushgateway.
*   [xk6-output-statsd (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/LeonAdato/xk6-output-statsd) - Enables real-time output of test metrics to a StatsD service.
*   [xk6-output-timestream (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/leonyork/xk6-output-timestream) - Export results to AWS Timestream.
*   [xk6-playwright (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/nicholasvuono/xk6-playwright) - Browser automation and end-to-end web testing using Playwright.
*   [xk6-prometheus (‚≠ê52)](https://github.com/szkiba/xk6-prometheus) - Prometheus HTTP exporter for k6.
*   [xk6-prompt (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/Juandavi1/xk6-prompt) - Support for input arguments via UI.
*   [xk6-sse (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/phymbert/xk6-sse) - A k6 extension for Server-Sent Events (SSE).
*   [xk6-tcp (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/NAlexandrov/xk6-tcp) - Send data to TCP port.
*   [xk6-top (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/szkiba/xk6-top) - Updating the current k6 metrics summaries on the terminal during the test run.
items.content_html:
Extensions / Official

  • xk6-client-tracing (‚≠ê56) - Client for load testing distributed tracing backends.
  • xk6-disruptor (‚≠ê110) - Inject faults to test üí£.
  • xk6-exec (‚≠ê26) - Run external commands.
  • xk6-kubernetes (‚≠ê70) - Interact with Kubernetes clusters.
  • xk6-loki (‚≠ê51) - Client for load testing Loki.
  • xk6-notification (‚≠ê22) - Create notifications.
  • xk6-output-influxdb (‚≠ê76) - Export results to InfluxDB v2.
  • xk6-output-kafka (‚≠ê26) - Export k6 results in real-time to Kafka.
  • xk6-output-timescaledb (‚≠ê33) - Export k6 results to TimescaleDB.
  • xk6-sql (‚≠ê156) - Load-test SQL Servers (PostgreSQL, MySQL and SQLite3 for now).
  • xk6-ssh (‚≠ê12) - SSH.

Extensions / Community

  • xk6-cable (‚≠ê28) - Test Action Cable and AnyCable functionality.
  • xk6-coap (‚≠ê16) - Interact with Constrained Application Protocol endpoints.
  • xk6-dotenv (‚≠ê33) - Load env vars from a .env file.
  • xk6-ethereum (‚≠ê11) - K6 extension for ethereum protocols.
  • xk6-faker (‚≠ê100) - Generate random fake data.
  • xk6-file (‚≠ê30) - Write files.
  • xk6-g0 (‚≠ê39) - Write k6 tests in golang.
  • xk6-kafka (‚≠ê182) - Load-test Apache Kafka. Includes support for Avro messages.
  • xk6-kv (‚≠ê23) - Share key-value data between VUs.
  • xk6-mock (‚≠ê14) - Mock HTTP(S) servers.
  • xk6-mqtt (‚≠ê55) - MQTT extension.
  • xk6-nats (‚≠ê14) - Provides NATS support for k6 tests.
  • xk6-opentelemetry (‚≠ê32) - Generate OpenTelemetry signals from within your test scripts.
  • xk6-output-elasticsearch (‚≠ê21) - Export results to Elasticsearch 8.x.
  • xk6-output-prometheus-pushgateway (‚≠ê14) - Export results to Prometheus pushgateway.
  • xk6-output-statsd (‚≠ê29) - Enables real-time output of test metrics to a StatsD service.
  • xk6-output-timestream (‚≠ê18) - Export results to AWS Timestream.
  • xk6-playwright (‚≠ê55) - Browser automation and end-to-end web testing using Playwright.
  • xk6-prometheus (‚≠ê52) - Prometheus HTTP exporter for k6.
  • xk6-prompt (‚≠ê16) - Support for input arguments via UI.
  • xk6-sse (‚≠ê26) - A k6 extension for Server-Sent Events (SSE).
  • xk6-tcp (‚≠ê19) - Send data to TCP port.
  • xk6-top (‚≠ê31) - Updating the current k6 metrics summaries on the terminal during the test run.

items.title: Awesome Data Engineering
items.content_text:
### Databases

*   Other
    *   [Tarantool (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/tarantool/tarantool/) - Tarantool is an in-memory database and application server.
    *   [GreenPlum](https://github.com/greenplum-db/gpdb) - The Greenplum Database (GPDB) - An advanced, fully featured, open source data warehouse. It provides powerful and rapid analytics on petabyte scale data volumes.
    *   [cayley (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/cayleygraph/cayley) - An open-source graph database. Google.
    *   [Snappydata (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/SnappyDataInc/snappydata) - SnappyData: OLTP + OLAP Database built on Apache Spark.
    *   [TimescaleDB](https://www.timescale.com/) - Built as an extension on top of PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB is a time-series SQL database providing fast analytics, scalability, with automated data management on a proven storage engine.
    *   [DuckDB](https://duckdb.org/) - DuckDB is a fast in-process analytical database that has zero external dependencies, runs on Linux/macOS/Windows, offers a rich SQL dialect, and is free and extensible.
items.content_html:
Databases

  • Other
    • Tarantool (‚≠ê3.5k) - Tarantool is an in-memory database and application server.
    • GreenPlum - The Greenplum Database (GPDB) - An advanced, fully featured, open source data warehouse. It provides powerful and rapid analytics on petabyte scale data volumes.
    • cayley (‚≠ê15k) - An open-source graph database. Google.
    • Snappydata (‚≠ê1k) - SnappyData: OLTP + OLAP Database built on Apache Spark.
    • TimescaleDB - Built as an extension on top of PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB is a time-series SQL database providing fast analytics, scalability, with automated data management on a proven storage engine.
    • DuckDB - DuckDB is a fast in-process analytical database that has zero external dependencies, runs on Linux/macOS/Windows, offers a rich SQL dialect, and is free and extensible.

items.title: Awesome Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### C++ / Reinforcement Learning

*   [RLtools (‚≠ê828)](https://github.com/rl-tools/rl-tools) - The fastest deep reinforcement learning library for continuous control, implemented header-only in pure, dependency-free C++ (Python bindings available as well).
items.content_html:
C++ / Reinforcement Learning

  • RLtools (‚≠ê828) - The fastest deep reinforcement learning library for continuous control, implemented header-only in pure, dependency-free C++ (Python bindings available as well).

items.title: Awesome Newsletters
items.content_text:
### Go / Svelte

*   [Golang Weekly](https://golangweekly.com/). A weekly newsletter about the Go programming language. [Archive](https://golangweekly.com/issues).
*   [Awesome Go Weekly](https://go.libhunt.com/newsletter). A weekly overview of the most popular Go news, articles and libraries.

### Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / Big Data / Svelte

*   [Air Around AI](https://airaroundai.substack.com/). Air Around AI is a weekly newsletter of the top news, best tutorials, product launches and super tips on AI.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:
### Blogs / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [daily.dev](https://app.daily.dev/tags/angular)

### Loggers / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [pretty-html-log (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/angular-extensions/pretty-html-log) - A module that allows you to pretty print the inner HTML of ComponentFixtures, DebugElements, NativeElements or even plain HTML strings to the console. This is very useful for debugging Angular component tests in Jest.
items.content_html:
Blogs / Google Developer Experts

  • daily.dev

Loggers / Google Developer Experts

  • pretty-html-log (‚≠ê38) - A module that allows you to pretty print the inner HTML of ComponentFixtures, DebugElements, NativeElements or even plain HTML strings to the console. This is very useful for debugging Angular component tests in Jest.

items.title: Awesome Creative Coding
items.content_text:
### Other

*   [shoebot](http://www.shoebot.net/) \[Cross-platform] - Shoebot is a creative coding environment designed for making vector graphics and animations with Python.
*   [DrawBot](http://www.drawbot.com/) \[Mac] - Education oriented 2d graphics programming environment based on Python.
items.content_html:
Other

  • shoebot [Cross-platform] - Shoebot is a creative coding environment designed for making vector graphics and animations with Python.
  • DrawBot [Mac] - Education oriented 2d graphics programming environment based on Python.
